name: thedailybeast
text: NEW: In September 2018, an obscure Hollywood talent agent reached out to a reporter at the National Enquirer with a hell of a story. Michael Sanchez said that one of the world’s wealthiest people had accidentally sent nudes of himself to a colleague. https://t.co/VvN1eWAFKW

name: thedailybeast
text: Less than four months later, the Enquirer ran a multi-part series exposing Amazon founder Jeff Bezos’s extramarital affair. But Sanchez has disputed public accounts of his involvement since then and has filed lawsuits against Bezos and AMI. https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text:
AMI moved to dismiss its lawsuit and sanction Sanchez for allegedly abusing the court system.

As part of that motion, AMI revealed new information about how the Bezos expose came together—and about Sanchez’s role in leaking information to the tabloid. https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text: Those documents tell AMI’s side of the story and Sanchez’s desire to sell the salacious tale. However, they also reveal inconsistencies in what AMI employees told each other, what Sanchez told them, what appeared in print, and what AMI has said publicly. https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text: Read the full story by @lachlan here: https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text: On this bonus episode of #TheLastLaugh podcast, comedian @JLCauvin reveals to @mattwilstein how his Trump impression blew up online. Not only does he sound exactly like Trump, he deftly captures the president’s nonsensical, unfocused speaking style. https://t.co/e164t2d8eA

name: thedailybeast
text:
“I think my voice has legitimately gotten roughed up from doing the impression so much,” Cauvin admits. 

With the coronavirus pandemic forcing offices to close, Cauvin has had a lot more time to spend on his comedy.  https://t.co/e164t2d8eA

name: thedailybeast
text:
“Putting out a new video always makes me feel better,” he says, saying that it’s “almost a dangerous thing.” He gets why Trump loves the attention from tweeting so much.
“If I’m receptive to it, [Trump is] OD’ing on it.” https://t.co/d33ObP3MOk

name: thedailybeast
text:
But Cauvin definitely has his share of competition, namely Sarah Cooper, another comedian whose Trump impersonations went viral.

“I jokingly call them the Coop and I call my group the Coven,” Cauvin says, and he’s sick of being told he “stole” her bit. https://t.co/d33ObP3MOk

name: thedailybeast
text: Though Cauvin claims to have no hard feelings towards Cooper, he says: “I would love to be known for my stand-up, but to then be known as the second best of something that I think I’m clearly the best at is a little annoying.” https://t.co/d33ObP3MOk

name: thedailybeast
text: Listen to @JLCauvin's full interview on #TheLastLaugh podcast here: https://t.co/d33ObP3MOk
